ğŸ“ DETAILED CONTENTS:

ğŸ“¦ Module 1: Discrete-time signals and systems

- Sampling theorem and Nyquist rate

ğŸ“¦ Module 2: Z-transform

- Properties for causal signals
- Stability in z-domain
- Inverse z-transforms

ğŸ“¦ Module 3: Discrete Fourier Transform (DFT)

- Properties of DFT
- Convolution of signals
- Fast Fourier Transform (FFT) algorithm
- Parsevalâ€™s Identity
- Implementation of discrete-time systems

ğŸ“¦ Module 4: Design of Digital Filters
- FIR filter design: Window method, Park-McClellan method
- IIR filter design: Butterworth, Chebyshev, Elliptic approximations
- Low-pass, Band-pass, Band-stop, High-pass filters
- Effect of finite register length in FIR filter design
- Parametric and non-parametric spectral estimation
- Introduction to multirate signal processing

ğŸ“¦ Module 5: Applications of DSP
- Correlation functions and power spectra
- Stationary processes
- Optimal filtering using ARMA model
- Linear mean-square estimation
- Wiener filter

Single-phase inverters: Full bridge square wave, quasi-square wave, PWM inverters, Fourier analysis of output, harmonic control, filters, and single-phase current source inverters.
Switching power supplies: Flyback and forward converters for SMPS, resonant converters, soft switching concepts, series loaded half-bridge DCâ€“DC converters.
Applications: Power line disturbances, EMI/EMC, power conditioners, UPS configurations, battery/charger sizing, DC motor drives, PM stepper motor drives.

Scientific Computing-100921.text:
ğŸ“˜ PAPER CODE: 100921
ğŸ“— Subject: Scientific Computing

ğŸ“Š COURSE STRUCTURE:
L:3  T:0  P:0  CREDIT:3

ğŸ“š DESCRIPTION:
Covers principles and methods in scientific computing, with emphasis on numerical analysis and algorithmic implementation. Topics include:
- **Introduction:** Sources of approximations, data, truncation and rounding errors, absolute/relative error, sensitivity, conditioning, backward error analysis, stability, and accuracy.
- **Computer Arithmetic:** Floating-point numbers, normalization, system properties, rounding, machine precision, subnormal numbers, gradual underflow, exceptional values, floating-point operations, and cancellation.
- **Systems of Linear Equations:** Gaussian elimination, pivoting, Gaussâ€“Jordan method, norms, condition numbers, symmetric positive definite and indefinite systems, iterative methods.
- **Linear Least Squares:** Data fitting, normal equations, orthogonalization, QR factorization, Gramâ€“Schmidt, rank deficiency, column pivoting.
- **Eigenvalues & Singular Values:** Computation methods (Jacobi, selected eigenvalues), singular value decomposition (SVD), and SVD applications.
- **Nonlinear Equations:** Fixed-point iteration, Newtonâ€™s method, inverse interpolation.
- **Optimization:** One-dimensional and multidimensional unconstrained optimization, nonlinear least squares.
- **Interpolation:** Polynomial and piecewise polynomial interpolation.
- **Numerical Integration & Differentiation:** Newtonâ€“Cotes, Gaussian quadrature, finite difference approximations.
- **ODEs & PDEs:** Euler, Taylor series, Rungeâ€“Kutta, extrapolation methods, finite difference and finite element methods, eigenvalue problems, time-dependent and time-independent PDE solutions.
- **Sparse Systems:** Iterative solvers.
- **FFT & Wavelets:** Fast Fourier Transform algorithms, DFT, polynomial multiplication, wavelets.
- **Random Numbers & Simulation:** Random number generators, quasi-random sequences, stochastic simulation.
